definitions.definition: The flesh (muscle tissue) of an animal used as food.
definitions.example: A large portion of domestic meat production comes from animals raised on factory farms.

definitions.definition: A type of meat, by anatomic position and provenance.
definitions.example: The butchery's profit rate on various meats varies greatly.

definitions.definition: Food, for animals or humans, especially solid food. See also meat and drink.
A type of food, a dish.
Any relatively thick, solid part of a fruit, nut etc.
definitions.example: The apple looked fine on the outside, but the meat was not very firm.

definitions.definition: The best or most substantial part of something.
definitions.example: We recruited him right from the meat of our competitor.

definitions.definition: The sweet spot of a bat or club (in cricket, golf, baseball etc.).
definitions.example: He hit it right on the meat of the bat.

definitions.definition: (Australian Aboriginal) A totem, or (by metonymy) a clan or clansman which uses it.
